Articles.Content:
Just some quick parts I am working on. I am no pro modder but I did whip these up right quick.

Radial Reaction Wheels:

On the sketchfab, that black should not be black. It has to do with something going screwy in my sketchup exporting (that's right, I use the dreaded program; it's only temporary until I get better with Blender, which I am learning).

EDIT: before people ask, the model is ~750 triangles. Not a bad poly count, especially for a first attempt.

Well, After some conversation, I will be joining the team for Wolfpack Aeronautics. If you wish to still see my stuff, I will try to keep this dev thread updated. All my published work will be available in the Wolfpack Aeronautics parts pack.

Another idea I had was a jet engine that would take in air and spray oxidizer (I'll assume liquid oxygen for this) into the airstream. That would them evaporate and consequently oxygenate the intake air. This would allow jet engines to burn. Now, I am not 100% sure how to make the intake actually consume my planned resource, OxFreeIntakeAir, and produce normal intake air. If anyone knows the coding for that (I don't want to use an engine module to do it), it'd be nice if you'd lemme know how. In the mean time, the plan is to also model an engine (and I really like this plan better because of all I can do with it) that uses OxFreeIntakeAir, Oxidiser, and LiquidFuel. I also wanna do some cool stuff with consuming power while spooling up and producing power when running at speed as well as a power curve that works better at higher speeds and lower altitudes (ramjet style almost).

Here is my intake model so far:
Jeeze. That intake must have been really hard to make in Sketchup.

Well, After some conversation, I will be joining the team for Wolfpack Aeronautics. If you wish to still see my stuff, I will try to keep this dev thread updated. All my published work will be available in the Wolfpack Aeronautics parts pack.

Welcome to the pack!

Jeeze. That intake must have been really hard to make in Sketchup.

Pshh, piece of cake. Took me all of an hour max, start to finish.
